comment: She made my last semester more stressful than it needed to be! Elaborate weekly discussion posts and additional excessive reading worksheets. I reached out about how some worksheets didn't have due dates on the calendar; she didn't address my concern and put in zeros, while refusing to grade them adequately. And a group project in an ONLINE class..
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Avoid this professor at all costs. The amount of busy work assignments for an upper level course is absurd. The directions for the assignments is never clear so we were all confused on how to do it. There is a group project at the end of the course, except this is an all online class so it is nearly impossible to have complete participation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Each week was straightforward and easy to keep up with. I felt that each lesson was extremely interesting, and her written lectures were insightful. The only issue I had was that I didn't know it was a 7-week course, and she made the final optional but then switched it to mandatory, which left little time to prepare. The final was easy, though!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: If im being real I didn't like her because we had hella work do quick in a short time frame worth a lot of points. 3 assignments that was the same thing due every Friday and discussions due Saturday. I soon realized I was in a 7 week class so check your class guys.She's not good with email but she an extremely easy grader and she made us take final
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: made no sense and responded to emails very slowly. had 3 reading sheets (worth 10 pt) and a discussion post w/ responses (worth 10 points for writing your own 5 for each reply) due every week and that was your grade. She said she wasn't going to give us a final, and then did and didn't even go by her syllabus. all in all, find another professor.

Was terrible when it came to grading, took her till the end of the course for her to grade. So much work including 3 worksheets and discussion posts every week, but the content was easy to understand.

In her syllabus she said that she would drop a discussion post at the end of the term, never did; she originally said that our final was going to be optional, then she changed her mind; no extra credit. Had to read a lot, 3 worksheets each week, with a discussion post & 2 replies so 6 assignments each week. Tedious but easy class overall.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER. The teacher's first week of class made us have two discussion posts due on the third day with 250 words on the original response and the 2 responses. Then, read 3 long Articles per chapter in the textbook and then do 3 worksheets on it. Then on her grade syllabus in order to get an A you have to be "The best in the class".
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This professor is awful! She was not understanding and wouldnt respond back on questions for assignments until after it was due online. Easy A despite her seemingly hating the whole class. Classic disconnected instructor seemingly focused on getting a phd. For an 300 class, had assignments that shouldve been in a 100 class like marvel movie reviews

Do your assignments and you will receive and A. You have to try and fail. I will say it is geared toward the traditional college student and not non-traditional (family, job, kids, etc.) like myself. I was able to tweek things like my resume and cover letter, & LinkedIn act. The only thing I didn't like, she doesn't return emails promptly.

Mostly the class consists of lectures and discussions on d2l. She is funny and friendly. Just pay attention in class, read from the textbook/study, and complete the discussions on d2l. She is lenient with grades, the final is easy look for quizlets online.

Clear on assignments (4 quizzes, mid-term and final with discussion on every other Friday that you can do from home). Each class starts with an open debate on current events. Test content comes straight from book. Lectures tend to not always be pertinent to current content. Study guide only for final.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Takes time in the beginning of each class for a class discussion on current events and she appreciates when you participate, but she won't make you if you don't. online discussion posts are super easy and quizzes are easy if you keep up with the reading! She is very helpful outside of class and makes material easy to understand.

Dr. Kperogi was a nice lady and funny during class discussions. However, her lectures werent the most engaging and easy to lose focus from. Her class was straightforward with 4 quizzes & a final and a midterm. There were discussion posts every other friday and we didnt have to show up on those days. Also, there was some group work but was easy
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She's nice, but her lectures are pretty dull. You're required to go to class for an attendance grade but I haven't learned much. If you're already well-versed in American Government, take her. Her tests are SUPER easy if you already know about the subject. Discussion posts every week, and no class on Fridays for my MWF class. Tends to get off topic
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Quizzes are difficult. Discussion posts are an easy 100. The midterm was online and the final study guide was on quizlet. Her lectures are fun but rarely on topic. Attendance is worth 50 points and she allows 3 missed classes.
Reads from powerpoint most of the class and tends to stay off topic. Tests are hard but discussion posts keep your grade up. Pretty easy if not good at political science.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Great teacher, understands that it is a required course for all students so she makes it as painless as possible. Lectures always start with discussions about recent news which is a good way to segue into the material. Quizzes are online, as is the midterm; final is in class. She is a wonderful person who understands her students' dispositions.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This online class is pretty straight forward, lots of reading, discussion post and weekly quiz for each chapter. Tests are not hard is pretty much the same as the weekly quizzes just worded differently.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class is straightforward, but the tests are insanely hard and mostly unrelated to the reading. Each one covers over 300 pages of material. Each week we read a 60 page chapter. The professor posts the chapter information and powerpoint literally the day before the assignments are due.  It's a lazy way to teach, I retained nothing in the end.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK
